Description: Three joined sherds of black-figure painted pottery amphora showing Herakles strangling the Nemean lion. Heracles to right, nude; the lion's left hind-leg is pressed against Heracles' left leg; the heads of both are lost. Purple on mane of lion. White as narrow stripe along its belly. The painting, but not the incision, of the fore-paw has been omitted.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 19 A, bench on west side
Curator's comments: BM Cat. Vases The composition is the upright one, cf. BM Vase Β160.
Findspot number '19A W' scratched on the item
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B129.7)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 608, 11)
